channel.title: Vps, How to Connect? Rep++
channel.description:
Hi guys, ive searched for the vps help section but couldn't find it so,
This is my first VPS i ever trying to use, so I've signed up for a 2 weeks free trial, so i setted up the ubunto vps
and now when i Log in from their Console (transIP.com) i get into a big CMD window, where i only can Enter commands
well maybe i need a other Program to connect to the vps to make it like a desktop, but Idc xd
so if someone can help me out i'll rep++

item.title: Vps, How to Connect? Rep++
item.dc:creator: @jaruanna jaruanna
item.description:
@jaruanna wrote:

no problem, anytime.

Read full topic

item.title: Vps, How to Connect? Rep++
item.dc:creator: @oldschool-scape oldschool-scape
item.description:
@oldschool-scape wrote:

hmm so ur saying if i use a windows vps i could connect, also virtualbox is huge, but i can give it a try

thx for the time rep.

Read full topic

item.title: Vps, How to Connect? Rep++
item.dc:creator: @jaruanna jaruanna
item.description:
@jaruanna wrote:

what website are you using?

EDIT:Wait maybe because your using a ubunto vps and you have windows? Yea, i think that’s the problem. Heres how you can connect to it:

The better approach for you may be to install VirtualBox and a Linux distribution as a virtual machine on your own PC, and spend some time getting acquainted with the O/S. See if that works for you and when you're comfortable with your local version, it's much easier to set up a Linux VPS and host a website. (from http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4162413/connecting-to-a-linux-vps-box-from-windows-machine)

Read full topic

item.title: Vps, How to Connect? Rep++
item.dc:creator: @oldschool-scape oldschool-scape
item.description:
@oldschool-scape wrote:

ye i tryed that but my windows desktop connection said cant connect, while i used the right IP, thats maybe cuz i’m using the free trial :s

Read full topic

item.title: Vps, How to Connect? Rep++
item.dc:creator: @jaruanna jaruanna
item.description:
@jaruanna wrote:

if you have windows, use windows remote desktop connection.

go to accessories, remote desktop connection, then type in ip. (you can go to options for more things)

Read full topic
